candidate Profile Description.summary: Anh Do, a PhD student in Computer Science at Johns Hopkins University, specializes in multi-armed bandits and reinforcement learning, focusing on algorithm design for multi-agent learning with theoretical guarantees. He has research experience at VinAI Research and Hiip Asia, Inc, contributing to projects on regret bounds in episodic MDPs and sentiment analysis for recommendation systems.

contact.location: 340 Malone Hall, 3400 N Charles St, Baltimore, MD 21218

education.institution: John von Neumann Institute - Vietnam National University
education.thesis: Regret Bounds for Optimistic Value Iteration

education.institution: HCM University of Technology - Vietnam National University

research_experience.project: Regret Bound for Optimistic Policy Iteration in Episodic MDPs
Built a sentiment analysis of a recommendation system for a platform of 10,000 influencers and 2,000,000 followers.

research_projects.title: Adaptive Multi-agent learning with Heterogeneous Multi-Armed Bandit Environment
research_projects.description: Designing an algorithm that is agnostic to the heterogeneity of the bandit environment, addressing challenges in the heterogeneous bandit environments.

research_projects.title: Cooperative Multi-agent Reinforcement Learning
research_projects.description: Building TanksWorld, a novel testbed for team versus team tank combat, to create a dynamic MARL environment with an explicit tradeoff between performance and safety. Experienced with training deep MARL using MA-PPO on OpenAI Gym Interface.

teaching_experience.institution: HCM University of Technology - Vietnam National University
HCM University of Technology - Vietnam National University
